meanings.definition: To outdo in intrigue or surpass in cunning.
meanings.sent1: She outintrigued her rival by uncovering the secret plan.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to outintrigue his opponents in the game of chess.
meanings.sent3: The spy outintrigued the enemy by planting false information.
meanings.sent4: Her clever disguise outintrigued even the most astute detective.
meanings.sent5: The plot twist in the movie outintrigued everyone in the audience.

meanings.definition: To be more interested or fascinated than someone else.
meanings.sent1: The young girl was outintrigued by the colorful butterflies in the garden.
meanings.sent2: He was outintrigued by the mysterious book he found in the library.
meanings.sent3: The cat outintrigued the dog with its playful antics.
meanings.sent4: Her adventurous spirit outintrigued her cautious friends.
meanings.sent5: The magic show outintrigued the children with its illusions.
